entry.title: Azerbaijan cuts internet supply to Nagorno-Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan cuts internet supply to Nagorno-Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
As Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh enters its second month, internet connection in Nagorno-Karabakh has been interrupted. According to the Internet operator in Nagorno-Karabakh, the cable leading from Armenia to Nagorno-Karabakh was damaged in the very section of the Lachin corridor, the only route between Armenia and Nagorno-Karabakh, where the Azerbaijani roadblock is located.

entry.title: Food & medicine shortages, closed preschools - Karabakh blockade enters second month

media:group.media:title: Food & medicine shortages, closed preschools - Karabakh blockade enters second month
media:group.media:description:
The humanitarian crisis in Artsakh (Nagorno-Karabakh) is worsening as Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of the Lachin corridor enters its second month. The corridor is the only route that gives Nagorno-Karabakh access to the outside world and to critical supplies.

entry.title: Medicine shortages in Karabakh put children‚Äôs lives on the line

media:group.media:title: Medicine shortages in Karabakh put children‚Äôs lives on the line
media:group.media:description:
The life of a 9-year-old boy from Artsakh (Nagorno-Karabakh) now depends on medicine that cannot be found in the region. As a result of Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of the only road connecting Artsakh to Armenia, regular shipments of food and medicine have stopped. Narine Danielyan, the mother of an ill child, worries that should her son‚Äôs condition worsen, he may be unable to receive proper treatment.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #artsakhunderblockade
